In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of the function `wrap_string`:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    res = ""
    for word in words
        if length(word)*2 > text_width || length(res) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            #Add newline and reset the result string
            res *= "\n"
        end
        res *= "$word "
    end
    return res
end
```

Here is an example of how you can call this function:

```julia
str = "This is a very long sentence that we want to wrap into multiple lines because it's too long for one line."
print(wrap_string(str, 20))
```

In the given string `"This is a very long sentence that we want to wrap into multiple lines because it's too long for one line."`, after wrapping each word whose length multiplied by two exceeds `text_width` or when adding the new word would exceed the maximum allowed characters, a newline character and reset are added to the resultant string. The resulting string is then returned.
